message: Thanks to homebrew it was easy setting up pypy and thanks to PyCon and the virtualenv I git that set up pretty fast. Working down my dependencies I have problems installing PIP on SnowLeopard
Anyone else solved "_imaging.c:75:20: error: Python.h: No such file or directory"?
That's a missing header file... You have XCode installed, right? What version?
Python.h not being found seems pretty fundamental
I've heard reports of PIL working under CPYext, so not sure what's up
You need a PyPy build with cpyext enabled to build extension modules.  Try one of the nightly builds on http://buildbot.pypy.org/nightly/trunk/
Thanks. The problem was/is that the homebrew Formula I used didn't include "include"... http://danielrech.net/2011/pypy-trunk-virtualenv-and-python2-7-on-mac-os-snow-leopard/
